FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Pizza Blends, Inc., Indianapolis Indiana is proud to inform all interested parties that our company is complying with OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard (PSM), Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations 1910.119, and EPA's Risk Management Program regulations (RMP), Title 40 CFR Part 68.  In addition to other state and local codes applicable to our facility and process. We have undertaken this process to deal with the risks involved with the storage, handling, and use of Anhydrous Ammonia in our facility.
Our goal is to promote overall worker, public, environmental, and plant safety.
Pizza Blends, Inc. is located at 404 South Kitley Avenue, Suite 200 Indianapolis, Indiana 46219. The facility manufactures pizza dough.  The facility includes processing tanks, piping, packaging equipment, raw materials warehousing, finished goods, refrigerated storage, an Ammonia refrigeration engine room, boilers, and miscellaneous utilities.  Also located at the facility is shipping and receiving docks.

The refrigeration system required for our production process necessitates the submission of this Risk Management Plan.  The refrigeration system contains more than the 10,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia as outlined in Process Safety Management and Risk Management Program regulations.

Worst Case and Alternate Case Release Scenarios: Many scenarios were considered and identified while conducting a Process Hazard Analysis. The scenarios chosen and others considered are included in the Risk Management Program binder along with other supporting documentation.

Pizza Blends, Inc. has implemented numerous policies and procedures to enable our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences of significant releases of Anhydrous Ammonia as well as other hazardous substances, fires, explosions, and other types of catastrophic accidents.  Overall these programs prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, and illnesses and avoid property damage.
Our safety programs prev

ent accidents because they focus on the rules, procedures, and practices that govern individual processes, activities, or pieces of equipment.  These rules are detailed and improved as necessary.  They are also communicated to and accepted by all employees at our facility.
Pizza Blends, Inc. has organized the information and polices pertaining to the process into a complete library consisting of 16 numbered volumes, some volume numbers are assigned to sets of reference manuals, such as; Equipment Operating Procedures, Operation and Maintenance manuals, etc.. 
Volume 1: Employee Participation
Volume 2: Mechanical Integrity, Incident Investigation, Trade Secrets
Volume 3: Process Safety Information Program
Volume 4: Process Safety Information Manuals and Data
Volume 5: Process Hazard Analysis 
Volume 6: Operating Procedures
Volume 7: Operator Training
Volume 8: Contractor Qualification
Volume 9: Management of Change and Pre-Startup Safety Review 
Volume 10: Compliance Audit
Volume 11: Emergency Planning and Response
Volume 12: Safety Inspection Forms
Volume 13: Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams
Volume 14: Master Tracking Report
Volume 15: Lockout/Tagout, Confined Space & Hot Work
Volume 16: (RMP) Risk Management Plan Submittal


DESCRIPTION OF THE REFRIGERATION SYSTEM
The facility incorporates an Ammonia Refrigeration System which is a standard Compression and Evaporation Style System Specifics are available through the office of the Plant Manager.


SUMMARY OF THE FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Pizza Blends, Inc. has had no reportable accidents in the last 5 years.


DESCRIPTION OF THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN

Emergency Response Plan Pizza Blends, Inc. Inc. has a written emergency action plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials. The plan includes all aspects of emergency action plan including evacuations and notification of local emergency response agencies and the public. Pizza Blends, Inc. Inc. works closely with lo

cal fire department and the LEPC for response to emergency situations including releases of anhydrous ammonia. 


PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Pizza Blends, Inc. is committed to continuous improvement of our policies, procedures, and facility. It is the intention of Pizza Blends, Inc. to remain an industry leader. New technology, training techniques, and equipment are continuously being evaluated and added to our system.
